The Group of Eights
The Chapter with Kaccāna🔽The Burning House Jātaka
“When a house is on fire,
whatever vessel you take out
is for your benefit,
but what burns there is not.
So the world is on fire
with aging and death.
You should take out with generosity;
what is given is well taken out.”
“One who gives a gift of what has been gained through Dhamma,
through energy and exertion,
having crossed over the realm of Yama,
that mortal goes to heavenly realms.
Giving and fighting are said to be the same:
even a few can defeat many.
Even if you have little faith and give little,

original: Teneva so hoti sukhī parattha.🔽Viceyya dānaṁ sugatappasatthaṁ,
analyzed: tena iva saḥ hoti sukhī parattha  viceyya dānam sugata ppasattha
translated: by that you will be happy in the next world.🔽Giving after examination is praised by the One of Good Conduct.
Those who are worthy of gifts in this world of the living,
when given to them, are of great fruit,

original: Bījāni vuttāni yathā sukhette.🔽Yo pāṇabhūtāni aheṭhayaṁ caraṁ,🔽Parūpavādā na karoti pāpaṁ;
analyzed: bījāni vuttāni yathā su khette  yaḥ pāṇabhūtāni aheṭhayam cara  parūpavādā na karoti pāpa
translated: like seeds sown in a good field.🔽One who goes about not harming living beings,🔽who does no evil through slander,
they praise the timid there, not the brave,

original: Bhayā hi santo na karonti pāpaṁ.
analyzed: bhayā hi santaḥ na karonti pāpa
translated: For the good do not commit sin out of fear.
By the lower life
one is reborn as a noble;
By the middle one becomes a god;

original: uttamena visujjhati.🔽Addhā hi dānaṁ bahudhā pasatthaṁ,
analyzed: uttamena visujjhati  addhā hi dānam bahudhā pasattha
translated: By the higher one is purified.🔽Surely, giving is praised in many ways;
But the word of the Dhamma is better than giving;

analyzed: pubbā iva hi pubbatarā iva santaḥ
translated: For the wise of old, even before,

analyzed: nibbānam eva ajjhagamum sa paññā ati
translated: Attained Nibbāna.”
The Jātaka of Āditta.
